question: For Freundlich adsorption isotherm, a graph of <katex>$log(x/m)$</katex> Vs. <katex>$log(P)$</katex> gives a straight line. The slope of line and its Y-axis intercept respectively are:
explanation: The linear equation is <katex>$\log(x/m) = \frac{1}{n} \log P + \log K$</katex>. Slope = <katex>$1/n$</katex>, Intercept = <katex>$\log K$</katex>.
